00019 /*! \file
00020  * \brief ADSI Support (built upon Caller*ID)
00021  */
00022 
00023 #ifndef _ASTERISK_ADSI_H
00024 #define _ASTERISK_ADSI_H
00025 
00026 #include "asterisk/callerid.h"
00027 
00028 /* ADSI Message types */
00029 #define ADSI_MSG_DISPLAY   132
00030 #define ADSI_MSG_DOWNLOAD  133
00031 
00032 /* ADSI Parameters (display) */
00033 #define ADSI_LOAD_SOFTKEY  128
00034 #define ADSI_INIT_SOFTKEY_LINE   129
00035 #define ADSI_LOAD_VIRTUAL_DISP   130
00036 #define ADSI_LINE_CONTROL  131
00037 #define ADSI_INFORMATION   132
00038 #define ADSI_DISC_SESSION  133
00039 #define ADSI_SWITCH_TO_DATA   134
00040 #define ADSI_SWITCH_TO_VOICE  135
00041 #define ADSI_CLEAR_SOFTKEY 136
00042 #define ADSI_INPUT_CONTROL 137
00043 #define ADSI_INPUT_FORMAT  138
00044 #define ADSI_SWITCH_TO_PERIPH 139
00045 #define ADSI_MOVE_DATA     140
00046 #define ADSI_LOAD_DEFAULT  141
00047 #define ADSI_CONNECT_SESSION  142
00048 #define ADSI_CLEAR_TYPE_AHEAD 143
00049 #define ADSI_DISPLAY_CALL_BUF 144
00050 #define ADSI_CLEAR_CALL_BUF   145
00051 #define ADSI_SWITCH_TO_ALT 146
00052 #define ADSI_SWITCH_TO_GRAPHICS  147
00053 #define ADSI_CLEAR_SCREEN  148
00054 #define ADSI_QUERY_CONFIG  149
00055 #define ADSI_QUERY_CPEID   150
00056 #define ADSI_SWITCH_TO_APP 151
00057 
00058 /* Feature download messages */
00059 #define ADSI_LOAD_SOFTKEY_TABLE  128   /* Conveniently identical to the soft version */
00060 #define ADSI_LOAD_PREDEF_DISP 129   /* Load predefined display */
00061 #define ADSI_LOAD_SCRIPT   130
00062 #define ADSI_DOWNLOAD_CONNECT 131
00063 #define ADSI_DOWNLOAD_DISC 132
00064 
00065 /* Special return string codes */
00066 #define ADSI_ENCODED_DTMF  0x80  /* Transmit following chars with encoded dtmf */
00067 #define ADSI_ON_HOOK    0x81  /* Open switch-hook */
00068 #define ADSI_OFF_HOOK      0x82  /* Close switch-hook */
00069 #define ADSI_FLASH      0x83  /* Flash switch-hook */
00070 #define ADSI_DIAL_TONE_DETECT 0x84  /* Wait for dialtone */
00071 #define ADSI_LINE_NUMBER   0x85  /* Send current line number using DTMF/encoded DTMF */
00072 #define ADSI_BLANK      0x86  /* Blank (does nothing) */
00073 #define ADSI_SEND_CHARS    0x87  /* Send collected digits/characters */
00074 #define ADSI_CLEAR_CHARS   0x88  /* Clear characters/digits collected */
00075 #define ADSI_BACKSPACE     0x89  /* Erase last collected digit */
00076 #define ADSI_TAB_COLUMN    0x8A  /* Display specified display column of current line */
00077 #define ADSI_GOTO_LINE     0x8B  /* Go to given page and line number */
00078 #define ADSI_GOTO_LINE_REL 0x8C  /* Go to given line (relative to current) */
00079 #define ADSI_PAGE_UP    0x8D  /* Go up one page */
00080 #define ADSI_PAGE_DOWN     0x8E  /* Go down one page */
00081 #define ADSI_EXTENDED_DTMF 0x8F  /* Send DTMF tones for 250ms instead of 60 ms */
00082 #define ADSI_DELAY      0x90  /* Delay for given # (times 10) of ms */
00083 #define ADSI_DIAL_PULSE_ONE   0x91  /* Send a dial pulse "1" */
00084 #define ADSI_SWITCH_TO_DATA2  0x92  /* Switch CPE to data mode */
00085 #define ADSI_SWITCH_TO_VOICE2 0x93  /* Switch CPE to voice mode */
00086 #define ADSI_DISP_CALL_BUF 0x94  /* Display specified call buffer */
00087 #define ADSI_CLEAR_CALL_B  0x95  /* Clear specified call buffer */
00088 
00089 #ifdef __ADSI_CPE
00090 /* These messages are reserved for the ADSI CPE only */
00091 #define ADSI_DISPLAY_CONTROL  0x98  /* Store predefined display identified next / Display status display page */
00092 #define ADSI_DISPLAY_SOFT_KEYS   0x99  /* Display the script soft keys identified next */
00093 #define ADSI_CHANGE_STATE  0x9A  /* Change state of service script */
00094 #define ADSI_START_CLEAR_TIMER   0x9B  /* Start / Clear timer */
00095 #define ADSI_SET_SCRIPT_FLAG  0x9C  /* Set / clear a script flag */
00096 #define ADSI_JUMP_TO_SUBSCRIPT   0x9D  /* Jump to specified subscript */
00097 #define ADSI_EVENT_22_TRIGGER 0x9E  /* Trigger an occurance of event 22 */
00098 #define ADSI_EVENT_23_TRIGGER 0x9f  /* Trigger an occurance of event 23 */
00099 #define ADSI_EXIT    0xA0  /* Exit the service script interpreter */
00100 #endif
00101 
00102 /* Display pages */
00103 #define ADSI_INFO_PAGE  0x0
00104 #define ADSI_COMM_PAGE  0x1
00105 
00106 #define ADSI_KEY_APPS   16 /* 16 to 33 reserved for applications */
00107 
00108 /* Justification */
00109 #define ADSI_JUST_LEFT  0x2
00110 #define ADSI_JUST_RIGHT 0x1
00111 #define ADSI_JUST_CENT  0x0   /* Center */
00112 #define ADSI_JUST_IND   0x3   /* Indent */
00113 
00114 #define ADSI_KEY_SKT 0x80  /* Load from SKT */
00115 #define ADSI_KEY_HILITE 0x40  /* Highlight key */
00116 
00117 #define ADSI_DIR_FROM_LEFT (0)
00118 #define ADSI_DIR_FROM_RIGHT (1)
00119 
00120 /*! Perform Asterisk ADSI initialization (for channel drivers that want */
00121 /*    to support ADSI when the handset is first lifted) */
00122 /*!
00123  * \param chan Channel to initialize for ADSI (if supported)
00124  *
00125  * Returns 0 on success (or adsi unavailable) and -1 on hangup
00126  *
00127  */
00128 extern int (*ast_adsi_channel_init)(struct ast_channel *chan);
00129 
00130 extern int (*ast_adsi_begin_download)(struct ast_channel *chan, char *service, unsigned char *fdn, unsigned char *sec, int version);
00131 
00132 extern int (*ast_adsi_end_download)(struct ast_channel *chan);
00133 
00134 /*! Restore ADSI initialization (for applications that play with ADSI */
00135 /*   and want to restore it to normal.  If you touch "INFO" then you */
00136 /*   have to use the ast_adsi_channel_init again instead. */
00137 /*!
00138  * \param chan Channel to restore
00139  *
00140  * Returns 0 on success (or adsi unavailable) and -1 on hangup
00141  *
00142  */
00143 extern int (*ast_adsi_channel_restore)(struct ast_channel *chan);
00144 
00145 /*! Display some stuff on the screen */
00146 /*!
00147  * \param chan Channel to display on
00148  * \param lines NULL-terminated list of things to print (no more than 4 recommended)
00149  * \param align list of alignments to use (ADSI_JUST_LEFT, ADSI_JUST_RIGHT, ADSI_JUST_CEN, etc..)
00150  * \param voice whether to jump into voice mode when finished
00151  *
00152  * Return 0 on success (or adsi unavailable) and -1 on hangup
00153  *
00154  */
00155 extern int (*ast_adsi_print)(struct ast_channel *chan, char **lines, int *align, int voice);
00156 
00157 /*! Check if scripts for a given app are already loaded.  Version may be -1 */
00158 /*   if any version is okay, or 0-255 for a specific version. */
00159 /*!
00160  * \param chan Channel to test for loaded app
00161  * \param app Four character app name (must be unique to your application)
00162  * \param ver optional version number
00163  * \param data Non-zero if you want to be put in data mode
00164  *
00165  * Returns 0 if scripts is not loaded or not an ADSI CPE.  Returns -1
00166  * on hangup.  Returns 1 if script already loaded.
00167  */
00168 extern int (*ast_adsi_load_session)(struct ast_channel *chan, unsigned char *app, int ver, int data);
00169 extern int (*ast_adsi_unload_session)(struct ast_channel *chan);
00170 
00171 /* ADSI Layer 2 transmission functions */
00172 extern int (*ast_adsi_transmit_messages)(struct ast_channel *chan, unsigned char **msg, int *msglen, int *msgtype);
00173 extern int (*ast_adsi_transmit_message)(struct ast_channel *chan, unsigned char *msg, int msglen, int msgtype);
00174 extern int (*ast_adsi_transmit_message_full)(struct ast_channel *chan, unsigned char *msg, int msglen, int msgtype, int dowait);
00175 /*! Read some encoded DTMF data.   */
00176 /*!
00177  * Returns number of bytes received
00178  */
00179 extern int (*ast_adsi_read_encoded_dtmf)(struct ast_channel *chan, unsigned char *buf, int maxlen);
00180 
00181 /* ADSI Layer 3 creation functions */
00182 
00183 /*! Connects an ADSI Display Session */
00184 /*!
00185  * \param buf Character buffer to create parameter in (must have at least 256 free)
00186  * \param fdn Optional 4 byte Feature Download Number (for loading soft keys)
00187  * \param ver Optional version number (0-255, or -1 to omit)
00188  *
00189  * Returns number of bytes added to buffer or -1 on error.
00190  *
00191  */
00192 
00193 extern int (*ast_adsi_connect_session)(unsigned char *buf, unsigned char *fdn, int ver);
00194 
00195 /*! Build Query CPE ID of equipment */
00196 /*!
00197  *  Returns number of bytes added to message
00198  */
00199 extern int (*ast_adsi_query_cpeid)(unsigned char *buf);
00200 extern int (*ast_adsi_query_cpeinfo)(unsigned char *buf);
00201 
00202 /*! Get CPE ID from an attached ADSI compatible CPE. */
00203 /*!
00204  * Returns 1 on success, storing 4 bytes of CPE ID at buf
00205  * or -1 on hangup, or 0 if there was no hangup but it failed to find the
00206  * device ID.  Returns to voice mode if "voice" is non-zero.
00207  */
00208 extern int (*ast_adsi_get_cpeid)(struct ast_channel *chan, unsigned char *cpeid, int voice);
00209 
00210 extern int (*ast_adsi_get_cpeinfo)(struct ast_channel *chan, int *width, int *height, int *buttons, int voice);
00211 
00212 /*! Begin an ADSI script download */
00213 /*!
00214  * \param buf Character buffer to create parameter in (must have at least 256 free)
00215  * \param service a 1-18 byte name of the feature
00216  * \param fdn 4 byte Feature Download Number (for loading soft keys)
00217  * \param sec 4 byte vendor security code
00218  * \param ver version number (0-255, or -1 to omit)
00219  *
00220  * Returns number of bytes added to buffer or -1 on error.
00221  *
00222  */
00223 
00224 extern int (*ast_adsi_download_connect)(unsigned char *buf, char *service, unsigned char *fdn, unsigned char *sec, int ver);
00225 
00226 /*! Disconnects a running session */
00227 /*!
00228  * \param buf Character buffer to create parameter in (must have at least 256 free)
00229  *
00230  * Returns number of bytes added to buffer or -1 on error.
00231  *
00232  */
00233 extern int (*ast_adsi_disconnect_session)(unsigned char *buf);
00234 
00235 /*! Disconnects (and hopefully saves) a downloaded script */
00236 /*!
00237  * \param buf Character buffer to create parameter in (must have at least 256 free)
00238  *
00239  * Returns number of bytes added to buffer or -1 on error.
00240  *
00241  */
00242 extern int (*ast_adsi_download_disconnect)(unsigned char *buf);
00243 
00244 /*! Puts CPE in data mode... */
00245 /*!
00246  * \param buf Character buffer to create parameter in (must have at least 256 free)
00247  *
00248  * Returns number of bytes added to buffer or -1 on error.
00249  *
00250  */
00251 extern int (*ast_adsi_data_mode)(unsigned char *buf);
00252 extern int (*ast_adsi_clear_soft_keys)(unsigned char *buf);
00253 extern int (*ast_adsi_clear_screen)(unsigned char *buf);
00254 
00255 /*! Puts CPE in voice mode... */
00256 /*!
00257  * \param buf Character buffer to create parameter in (must have at least 256 free)
00258  * \param when (a time in seconds) to make the switch
00259  *
00260  * Returns number of bytes added to buffer or -1 on error.
00261  *
00262  */
00263 extern int (*ast_adsi_voice_mode)(unsigned char *buf, int when);
00264 
00265 /*! Returns non-zero if Channel does or might support ADSI */
00266 /*!
00267  * \param chan Channel to check
00268  *
00269  */
00270 extern int (*ast_adsi_available)(struct ast_channel *chan);
00271 
00272 /*! Loads a line of info into the display */
00273 /*!
00274  * \param buf Character buffer to create parameter in (must have at least 256 free)
00275  * \param page Page to load (ADSI_COMM_PAGE or ADSI_INFO_PAGE)
00276  * \param line Line number to load (1-4 for Comm page, 1-33 for info page)
00277  * \param just Line justification (ADSI_JUST_LEFT, ADSI_JUST_RIGHT, ADSI_JUST_CENT, ADSI_JUST_IND)
00278  * \param wrap Wrap (1 = yes, 0 = no)
00279  * \param col1 Text to place in first column
00280  * \param col2 Text to place in second column
00281  *
00282  * Returns number of bytes added to buffer or -1 on error.
00283  *
00284  */
00285 
00286 extern int (*ast_adsi_display)(unsigned char *buf, int page, int line, int just, int wrap, char *col1, char *col2);
00287 
00288 /*! Sets the current line and page */
00289 /*!
00290  * \param buf Character buffer to create parameter in (must have at least 256 free)
00291  * \param page Which page (ADSI_COMM_PAGE or ADSI_INFO_PAGE)
00292  * \param line Line number (1-33 for info page, 1-4 for comm page)
00293  *
00294  * Returns number of bytes added to buffer or -1 on error.
00295  *
00296  */
00297 
00298 extern int (*ast_adsi_set_line)(unsigned char *buf, int page, int line);
00299 
00300 /*! Creates "load soft key" parameters */
00301 /*!
00302  * \param buf Character buffer to create parameter in (must have at least 256 free)
00303  * \param key Key code from 2 to 33, for which key we are loading
00304  * \param llabel Long label for key (1-18 bytes)
00305  * \param slabel Short label for key (1-7 bytes)
00306  * \param ret Optional return sequence (NULL for none)
00307  * \param data whether to put CPE in data mode before sending digits
00308  *
00309  * Returns number of bytes added to buffer or -1 on error.
00310  *
00311  */
00312 extern int (*ast_adsi_load_soft_key)(unsigned char *buf, int key, const char *llabel, const char *slabel, char *ret, int data);
00313 
00314 /*! Set which soft keys should be displayed */
00315 /*!
00316  * \param buf Character buffer to create parameter in (must have at least 256 free)
00317  * \param keys Array of 8 unsigned chars with the key numbers, may be OR'd with ADSI_KEY_HILITE
00318  *             But remember, the last two keys aren't real keys, they're for scrolling
00319  *
00320  * Returns number of bytes added to buffer or -1 on error.
00321  *
00322  */
00323 extern int (*ast_adsi_set_keys)(unsigned char *buf, unsigned char *keys);
00324 
00325 /*! Set input information */
00326 /*!
00327  * \param buf Character buffer to create parameter in (must have at least 256 free)
00328  * \param page Which page to input on (ADSI_COMM_PAGE or ADSI_INFO_PAGE)
00329  * \param line Line number to input on
00330  * \param display Set to zero to obscure input, or 1 to leave visible
00331  * \param format Format number to use (0-7)
00332  * \param just Justification (left, right center, indent)
00333  *
00334  * Returns number of bytes added to buffer or -1 on error.
00335  *
00336  */
00337 extern int (*ast_adsi_input_control)(unsigned char *buf, int page, int line, int display, int format, int just);
00338 
00339 /*! Set input format */
00340 /*!
00341  * \param buf Character buffer to create parameter in (must have at least 256 free)
00342  * \param num Which format we are setting
00343  * \param dir Which direction (ADSI_DIR_FROM_LEFT or ADSI_DIR_FROM_RIGHT)
00344  * \param wrap Set to 1 to permit line wrap, or 0 if not
00345  * \param format1 Format for column 1
00346  * \param format2 Format for column 2
00347  *
00348  * Returns number of bytes added to buffer or -1 on error.
00349  *
00350  */
00351 extern int (*ast_adsi_input_format)(unsigned char *buf, int num, int dir, int wrap, char *format1, char *format2);
00352 
00353 #endif /* _ASTERISK_ADSI_H */
